transcripts.text: Senator, we have a deficit.  We have Social Security and Medicare looming.  Would you consider looking at those programs, age of eligibility, cost of living, put it all on the table?

The answer is absolutely, you have to.  I mean, one of the things that the political advisors say to me is, whoa, don't touch that third.  Look, the American people aren't stupid.  It's a real simple proposition.  Social Security is not the hard one to solve.  Medicare, that is the gorilla in the room.  And you've got to put all of it on the table.

People all over this country say that is nuts.  That's nuts.  Anybody in the Congress who believes in cutting these life-important benefits, we're going to give them a political choice they can't refuse.  and that is that they both the cut social security.  they may well not be returning washington.
